text.0: what worthy praise will bring before us indra the son of strength that he may grant us riches.
text.1: for he the hero gives the singer treasures he is the lord who sends us gifts ye people.
text.2: to be invoked and hymned in fight with vṛtra that wellpraised indra gives us real bounties.
text.3: that maghavan brings comfort in the foray to the religious man who pours libations.
text.4: him verily the men invoke in combat risking their lives they make him their protector.
text.5: when heroes foe to foe give up their bodies fighting each side for children and their offspring.
text.6: strong god the folk at need put forth their vigour striving together in the whirl of battle.
text.7: when warrior bands encounter one another some in the grapple quit themselves like indra.
text.8: hence many a one worships the might of indra hence let the brew succeed the mealoblation.
text.9: hence let the soma banish those who pour not even hence i joy to pay the strong one worship.
text.10: indra gives comfort to the man who truly presses for him who longs for it the soma.
text.11: not disaffected with devoted spirit this man he takes to be his friend in battles.
text.12: he who this day for indra presses soma prepares the brew and fries the grains of barley.
text.13: loving the hymns of that devoted servant to him may indra give heroic vigour.
text.14: when the impetuous chief hath sought the conflict and the lord looked upon the longdrawn battle.
text.15: the matron calls to the strong god whom pressers of soma have encouraged in the dwelling.
text.16: he bid a small price for a thing of value i was content returning still unpurchased.
text.17: he heightened not his insufficient offer simple and clever both milk out the udder.
text.18: who for ten milchkine purchaseth from me this indra who is mine.
text.19: when he hath slain the vṛtras let the buyer give him back to me.
text.20: now indra lauded glorified with praises let wealth swell high like rivers for the singer.
text.21: for thee a new hymn lord of bays is fashioned may we carborne through song be victors ever.
